title: Help! League wont open for me (windows 8)
body: so i was going to play league today when suddenly after league prompted me to run the program as an admin my avast anti virus went off and said it deleted something. i didn't think that this would lead to anything serious so i went on to start up the program again and after i click yes when the admin prompt comes up, league just shuts its self down with no warning. Any suggestions would be helpful, Thank you!

replies.body: Its working for me now guys! Good luck

Hey Loyal Lutheran, 
 
I'm sorry to hear that you're having this issue. I have a couple of things that can help resolve this. First off, make sure you update your Avast Antivirus. You can find the most up to date virus definitions for download [here](http://www.avast.com/download-update)!
 
Second step is adding League of Legends to your Exclusion list. We have a Firewall troubleshooting guide [here](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/201752664-Troubleshooting-Connection-Issues#jwq2) that will show you which files to add. 
 
 Please let me know if that works for you!

Ok so I added League of legends to my exemptions and then i uninstalled league. after uninstalling it i then went into my downloads file and i started the re-install and it worked so thank for everyone who helped!

The problem is that Avast actually deleted a part of the game and it can't launch anymore. And the signup page is actually frozen so reinstalling is impossible: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/E7pJuBvh-cannot-download-league

> The problem is that Avast actually deleted a part of the game and it can't launch anymore. And the signup page is actually frozen so reinstalling is impossible: http://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/bug-report/E7pJuBvh-cannot-download-league

We're currently performing maintenance on the Sign up page, which is why you're not able to go there. Do you know what file Avast is removing that is causing this issue?


Otherwise, You may be able to work around the game not launching by launching from the Lol.launcher.admin.exe file. You can find it at this location:

C:\Riot Games\League of Legends

No, I didn't have time to see which file was getting deleted. The pop-up message didn't stay long enough. I changed Avast specifications now so if it happens again, I should be able to see which one is affected. I'll tell you if I see it.

Any idea how long the maintenance will last for the signup page ?

> No, I didn't have time to see which file was getting deleted. The pop-up message didn't stay long enough. I changed Avast specifications now so if it happens again, I should be able to see which one is affected. I'll tell you if I see it.
> 
> Any idea how long the maintenance will last for the signup page ?

Unfortunately, I don't have that information. We're working as fast as we can to finish the maintenance. It looks like ShoulderPops saw that it deleted lolclient and the lol.launcher files. Were you able to run the Lol.launcher.admin.exe?
But what happen if u got a different anti virus? Like for me i got Avg and it still don't work even i put it in the Exclusion list.
I have Avast virus scan and I was having the same problem so I looked into my virus vault and it deleted the LoLClient.exe and the LoLLauncher.exe.  I hope this helps

First off add league to your exceptions list in your antivirus, then try running again.  if your antivirus really did delete part of the client you may have to reinstall the client completely if it doesn't let you get to the repair tool.
Same problem. RIOT at it's best..
